head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #5

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #5 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy on her passage to Sandusky Bay in the month of July 1813.

At 4 PM the Chippewa sails for Amherstburg by her I send a letter, the Ellen remains at anch[or] in company with the Nancy – wind WNW & showery – latter part of the 24 Hours set the watc[h.] The West sister bears W½ North from Snake or Grego Island[.] The Middle Sister bears form Pudding Bay NW½N[.] Course from ballast Island giving it a good birth to West end of Cunninghams Islan[d] SSE of the West end of Cunninghams Island leaving it about ½ mile on your left hand you have 4½ fathom water[.] Course from West end of Cunninghams Island to the bluff Point on the West side of Sandusky bay SE by S½ South – distant about 8 miles[.]

Fore part of this day wind West & moderate, clear pleasant weather, the General in his own boat makes a tour of the Islands at 9 returns on board – at 10 AM by order of the Genl I go round the Island, from the back of it discover a boat making towards us, unfurled our colours – & I lay by for the strange boat which we suppose to be one our own coming in for information, abreast the Vessels & on the back of the Island sent Jonas across to inform the Genl of it – ¼ of an hour afterwards the boat comes up with us – proves to be Mr Mr Robt Dickson & Major Chambers – pursue our tour round the Island, discover our small bower boy on the beach – arrive on board, at 4 hove up & towed out of the Bay the Ellen in company at 6 sounded between put in bay Island & ballast island find the deepest water 10ft10I & a narrow Channel – at 8 light airs at ESE all sails set at ½ past 8 larboard tacks aboard – keep the leads agoing soundings from 6 to 7 fathom water at ½ past 10 starboard tacks aboard wind the same ½ past 11 came too in 7 fathom water handed all Sails & set the watch also a watch of sentries – now calm

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
